dataset_limitations.impact: High - Insufficient data for complex models to learn patterns
High - Models may be biased towards majority class

dataset_limitations.description: Only 3 types of tampering (Copy-move, Retouching, Splicing)
dataset_limitations.impact: Medium - May not cover all real-world tampering scenarios
Medium - May not generalize to diverse image types

issues: Low ROC AUC scores indicate poor probability calibration
Limited data prevents deep models from learning complex patterns
Ensemble methods not improving over individual models
Custom ensemble implementations failed due to sklearn compatibility
Voting classifiers perform same as best individual model
Feature scaling issues with extreme values
Limited discriminative power for this dataset

data_quality.description: All images are high resolution (2480x3500) but may have quality variations
data_quality.impact: Medium - Inconsistent quality may affect feature extraction
High - Sophisticated tampering is harder to detect

data_quality.description: Binary masks available but may not perfectly align with actual tampering
data_quality.impact: Medium - Imperfect ground truth affects model training

data_quality.description: High-quality tampering may not leave detectable artifacts
data_quality.impact: High - Traditional forensic features may be insufficient

root_causes.description: Only 136 images total with 108 for training is insufficient for complex models
evidence: Deep learning models show early stopping

root_causes.description: 3:1 ratio of tampered to original images causes bias
evidence: Models show high recall but low precision
ROC AUC scores are very low
Confusion matrices show bias towards tampered class

root_causes.description: Traditional forensic features may not capture sophisticated tampering
evidence: Features may not be discriminative enough
Professional tampering may not leave detectable artifacts
root_causes.impact: High - Features may not be suitable

root_causes.description: Models too complex for available data size
evidence: Simple models perform as well as complex ones

immediate_actions: Implement aggressive data augmentation (rotation, scaling, color jittering)
Use class weighting in all models to handle imbalance
Apply SMOTE or similar oversampling techniques
Reduce model complexity to prevent overfitting
medium_term_actions: Collect more diverse tampered and original images
Implement transfer learning with pre-trained models
Use attention mechanisms in deep learning models
long_term_actions: Create synthetic tampered images using GANs
Develop multi-modal approaches (combine multiple detection methods)
Implement active learning to identify informative samples
Collaborate with forensic experts for better feature engineering
technical_improvements: Use ensemble methods that work with small datasets
Apply feature selection to reduce redundancy
